patterns: hi, how are you doing?
What's going on?
How are you doing today?
How's it going?
Everything's been good with you?
responses: I'm fine. What's going on with you?
Not much.
i'm fine. how about yourself?
What's going on with you?
I'm doing great. What about you?
I haven't been better. How about yourself?
I started school recently.

patterns: I'm having a party this Friday.
This Friday, I'm throwing a party.
I'm having a party next Saturday.
I'm throwing a party on Friday.
I'm having a party on Friday.
responses: I had no idea.
I didn't hear anything about it.
Oh really? I didn't know that.
I'm sorry, I can't.
I don't think so.

patterns: Is that right?
Are you serious?
Can you go?
Are you going to come?
Is there a reason why?
responses: I'll go.
No doubt.
I wish you luck.
I'll definitely try to make it the next time.
Yeah, sorry.

patterns: My back is killing me.
What did you do?
I injured my back one time just by sneezing.
You should see a doctor.
My doctor said I need surgery.
responses: That's it?
You should see a doctor.
So?
I have no insurance.
Maybe a back rub would help.

patterns: My brother smokes three packs a day.
Three packs of what?
When he is almost finished with one cigarette, he uses it to light another.
He's been a chain smoker for 30 years.
Can he still breathe?
responses: Cigarettes, of course.
How can he do that?
He's a chain smoker.
That's unbelievable.
He can, but the people around him can't.

patterns: I hate brushing my teeth.
It's such a chore.
Brush, brush. Spit, spit.
Why do they call it the good old days?
Who invented flossing?
responses: It's such a chore.
Brush, brush. Spit, spit.
They brushed with their fingers.
They also ate with their fingers!
Maybe because they didn't have to brush and floss.

patterns: Let's stop for a while. I need a break and some water.
This trail is hard to climb.
All we've seen so far is a couple of lizards.
We're hiking to lose weight, not to see goats and bears.
I bet I've lost a couple of pounds already.
responses: Especially on a hot day like this.
I can't believe we haven't seen any animals.
Thank goodness! I don't want to see any wild animals.
All you've lost is some sweat.
All you've lost is some sweat.

patterns: Oh no, another pimple on my face.
Pimples suck.
It seems like I get a new pimple almost every day.
Maybe it's something in your diet.
Do pimples run in your family?
responses: It's such a chore.
Maybe it's something in your diet.
You might be right.
No, I eat the same things day after day.
Not that I've noticed.

patterns: Do you believe everything you hear?
You can't believe what you hear on TV or radio.
You can't believe what you read in the newspapers.
Everyone tells you a different story about the same thing.
And the government will give you a fourth story.
responses: I don't believe anything I don't see with my own eyes.
You can't believe what you hear on TV or radio.
Three different people will give you three different stories.
Yes, like the government says not to worry about the swine flu.
But the swine flu just killed 20 people in Mexico.

patterns: Don't pick your nose.
What were you doing?
I think I know the difference between picking and scratching.
Okay, maybe I was picking it a little bit.
I didn't have a tissue.
responses: I wasn't picking my nose.
I was scratching my nose.
Use a tissue next time.
Then wait until you find a tissue.
I didn't have a tissue.

patterns: I saw Dad wipe his nose on his sleeve yesterday.
I bet Dad did it all the time when he was my age.
Your daddy was a good little boy.
How do you know? Were you his mommy, too?
responses: I will talk to your father about that.
Your daddy was a good little boy.
How do you know? Were you his mommy, too?

patterns: I'm worried.
I'm getting married.
Marriage is a lot of responsibility.
Are you going to start a family?
We want to have a little boy and a little girl.
responses: You should be happy, not worried.
Yes, you have to take care of your wife.
And I have to take care of our children.
That sounds wonderful, except we can't afford it!

patterns: I don't get art.
They're in a different world.
But it was full of pencils! How could he say it was empty?
Artists see things differently.
Did you ever see anything that Picasso painted?
responses: Or artists.
I saw a painting of a jar that was full of pencils.
The artist said the jar was both full and empty.
Artists see things differently.
Of course! He's world-famous.

patterns: What's the point?
Of living.
We must be here for some reason.
Maybe we're here to have fun.
Then why aren't I having fun?
responses: The point of what?
Who knows? You live, and then you die.
Maybe we're here to have fun.
Stop thinking about what the point is. Just be patient. Fun doesn't come along every five minutes.

patterns: Beer is a powerful drug.
So are cigarettes.
When you die and go to heaven, they will offer you beer or cigarettes.
I could pick only one or the other?
Boy, that's a tough one.
responses: So are cigarettes.
What do you mean?
Yes, nothing's perfect, not even in heaven.
Boy, that's a tough one.

patterns: My pants have a hole in the front pocket.
You shouldn't carry pens in your pocket.

Criminals, of course.
responses: You shouldn't carry pens in your pocket.
Lucky for you it wasn't a sharp knife.
Who carries a sharp knife in their pocket?
Criminals, of course.

patterns: I can't remember jokes.
They go in one ear and out the other.

Who knows? But there must be a hundred new ones every day.
responses: Neither can I.
Some of it is okay, I guess.
Artists see things differently.
Did you ever see anything that Picasso painted?

patterns: I'm not very smart.
I don't know. I think I'm average.

I wish I was really smart.
Don't be ridiculous. If you're going to make a wish, wish that you were really rich or famous.
responses: I don't know anyone who likes it.
Some of it is okay, I guess.
No one makes any money at it.
Did he get rich from his poetry?
Probably not.

patterns: Do you know what today is?

responses: Yes, it's April 22.

It's all over the news.

patterns: I don't like our flag.

responses: What's the matter with it?

responses: Sunday is Mother's Day.

responses: I don't know anyone who likes it.

patterns: I missed the TV news last night. What was on?
What's the weather going to be like this weekend?

responses: Nothing that would pass as news.

Some actress was in court for driving without a license.
Some actor married a woman young enough to be his daughter.
